long_description:
With spring being all about flowers, plants and everything in between, you might be wondering where can one overdose in blooms of all colors, shapes and sizes. Whether you want to purchase an elegant bouquet or tour a garden on your next visit to Royalton New York Hotel, New York has it all.

A Bit of History: Flower District

Head to 28th St., between 6th and 7th Avenues to visit the famous Flower District. Although the new number of flower wholesalers has dramatically dropped the last few years, you can still wandering through small paradises set right on the street.

Over a century ago, European immigrants could be seen pushing carts of flowers and lush plants through Manhattan. As demand increased, so did the number of sellers until a market was established between 26th and 29th Streets in the late 19th century. As the years went by, the area became known as the Flower District, a neighborhood where family-run flower businesses thrived. 

Today, several of these businesses are still going strong in the same building where they first started. Taking a walk along 28th St. will fill your nostrils with delicious scents while your eyes feast not only on the gorgeous flowers and plants, but also on the architecture and history.  

New York Botanical Garden

The Orchid Show
When: March 3, 2018 to April 22, 2018
One of the most famous shows of NYBG returns this year with a great twist. Daniel Ost, a floral artist, designed the exhibition with orchids arranged as living sculptures. In doing so, he managed to highlight the particularities of each species, as well as their textures and colors.

Daffodil Celebration and Wine Weekend
When: April 28, 2018 and April 29, 2018. From 12pm to 4pm
If you combine spring, flowers, local produce and wine, what’s the result? Daffodil Celebration and Wine Weekend! This festival focuses more on presenting visitors with exquisite local wine and food as they stroll through the garden to the sound of live music.

Rose Garden Weekend
When: June 9, 2018 and June 10, 2018. From 11am to 4pm
Roses are probably the most famous and symbolic flowers on earth and NYBG knows how to throw them a party. Head to the Peggy Rockefeller Rose Garden on Rose Garden Weekend to see beautiful specimens, learn how to cultivate them and enjoy some live music.

Brooklyn Botanical Garden

Sakura Matsuri 2018
When: April 28, 2018 and April 29, 2018. From 10am to 6pm.
For a weekend only, Brooklyn Botanical Garden will pay tribute to Japanese culture through a festival of performances, traditional music and Japanese tea ceremonies. Cherry blossoms, Japanese sakura, will be the main focus of the festival and photo opportunities will be endless.
